fr.sorbonne_u.components.helpers

Class WindowOutputStream

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.event.WindowAdapter
      • fr.sorbonne_u.components.helpers.WindowOutputStream
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.WindowFocusListener, java.awt.event.WindowListener, java.awt.event.WindowStateListener, java.lang.Runnable, java.util.EventListener

    public class WindowOutputStream
extends java.awt.event.WindowAdapter
implements java.awt.event.WindowListener, java.lang.Runnable
    The class WindowOutputStream creates a JFrame with a text area to which the stdout and the stderr are redirected.

    Description

    Slightly adapted from an example found on the Internet... TODO: No time right now to do better.

    Invariant

     invariant              true

    Created on : 2018-08-28

    Author:
    unknown

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      WindowOutputStream(java.lang.String frameTitle, int x, int y, int xLayout, int yLayout)
      create a new frame in a group where the first will be put at the position (x, y) while xLayout and yLayout allow to position the frame in the group (e.g., xLayout = 1 and yLayout = 1 will put the frame at the right and below the origin frame).

    • Constructor Detail

      • WindowOutputStream

        public WindowOutputStream(java.lang.String frameTitle,
                          int x,
                          int y,
                          int xLayout,
                          int yLayout)
        create a new frame in a group where the first will be put at the position (x, y) while xLayout and yLayout allow to position the frame in the group (e.g., xLayout = 1 and yLayout = 1 will put the frame at the right and below the origin frame).

        Contract

         pre    true                    // no precondition.
 post   true                    // no postcondition.
        Parameters:
        frameTitle - title to be put on the frame.
        x - x origin of the first frame.
        y - y origin of the first frame.
        xLayout - increment in x (starting at 0) giving the relative position of the frame.
        yLayout - increment in y (starting at 0) giving the relative position of the frame.
